conclusion: Analyzing electromagnetic induction and forces acting on the conductor rod MN.
Conductor rod MN moves at constant velocity v on parallel rails connected by a resistor R.
Uniform magnetic field B points vertically downward; kinetic friction coefficient μ exists between rod and rails.
External force F pushes the rod to maintain constant velocity.
Induced EMF ε = Blv due to rod moving through magnetic field.
Current I = Blv/(R + r) flows through the circuit.
Magnetic force F_magnetic = B²l²v/(R + r) acts on the rod opposing motion.
For constant velocity, net force on the rod must be zero.
Forces on the rod: external force F, magnetic force F_magnetic, friction force F_friction.
Power dissipated in resistor R: P_R = B²l²v²R/(R + r)².
Alternative calculation of power: P_R = (Blv)²R/(R + r)².
Final answer: Power dissipated in resistor R is B²l²v²R/(R + r)².
